result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clinton Anthony Campbell IV

defendant.name: Campbell, Clinton Anthony, IV
defendant.address: 9800 West Menomonee Park Court, #5, Milwaukee, WI 53225

records.addlTxt: Order Appointing Counsel, signed and filed.

Defendant Clinton Anthony Campbell IV in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant informed the Court he was unable to retain private counsel for reasons set forth in the record.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  
Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  
The court appointed Attorney Christopher Hartley to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $150.00 per month beginning on 12/1/2022 and then the 1st of each month there after.  
Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. 
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Samantha M. H. dob: 9/15/97. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Clinton Anthony Campbell IV appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Elizabeth Holloway appeared by video for Clinton Anthony Campbell IV.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Triggiano, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
